channel.title: Raw back?
channel.description:
Well got ddosed and put under today. Fought it well with iptables until it was eating to much of the pipe and the host pulled it.
What makes me think it is raw is one: It was a heavy ddos as in they had to null route the ips. Of the 4 times this has happened to me, 3 of them have been raw.
And also no one has even said they were going to do it or said they did it.
151.77.142.222 195.23.20.135 200.62.89.55 68.149.159.103 89.103.79.229 91.16.74.199 87.13.211.128 x 212.71.37.108 x 212.71.37.109 x 212.71.37.110 x 212.71.37.106 24.250.198.27 200.60.150.206 206.15.129.33 84.136.188.50 69.208.0.81 86.145.1.132 201.65.25.130 70.83.175.126 24.110.80.15 195.29.116.18 190.24.115.12 89.117.51.173

item.title: Raw back?
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

You can but the cpanel interface knows precisely which testicle it sucks. We don’t have shell access and I know very little about the traffic on the site except in the raw access logs which you have to download every day and don’t give you any indication of the real time data. After a certain threshold the number of connections is restricted to a level that even without the attack makes serving one or two users a challenge. You then need to email them to take off the limit.

Assuming thats its an attack and you know precisely when it starts at the end of this process the site is still down for an hour at least.

Read full topic

item.title: Raw back?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Block that useragent, or temporarily null route all IPs that use that useragent, that should stop or block the attack until they stop. If you don’t know how to do that I can help.

Read full topic

item.title: Raw back?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Same people attacked this site today as well.

HSTDTXS07:~# route -n Kernel IP routing table Destination Gateway Genmask Flags Metric Ref Use Iface 90.195.59.166 - 255.255.255.255 !H 0 - 0 - 69.247.85.26 - 255.255.255.255 !H 0 - 0 - 97.82.164.187 - 255.255.255.255 !H 0 - 0 - 201.65.25.130 - 255.255.255.255 !H 0 - 0 - 78.114.4.93 - 255.255.255.255 !H 0 - 0 - 24.250.198.27 - 255.255.255.255 !H 0 - 0 - 83.55.73.96 - 255.255.255.255 !H 0 - 0 - 69.208.0.81 - 255.255.255.255 !H 0 - 0 -

That is my current routing table and it keeps the site reachable, turns out this is the same attack that was used on ruler. The bots have some very easily distinguishable features that, given the right access log format and scripts, are easily banned.

Read full topic
